questions.question: Which of the following data structures uses a FIFO approach?
What is the time complexity of accessing an element in an array?
In a binary search tree, the left child of a node contains a value which is:
options: Arbitrarily greater or less than the parent node

questions.question: Which of the following is not a linear data structure?
What data structure is used for implementing recursion?
Which of the following sorting algorithms is not a comparison sort?
What is the worst-case time complexity of a binary search algorithm?
Which of the following is an example of a dynamic data structure?
What is the maximum number of children for a node in a binary tree?
options: It depends on the type of binary tree

questions.question: In hash tables, what is a 'collision'?
options: When a hash function generates a unique index for every key
When two keys are exactly the same
When two different keys generate the same index
When the table is full and no more keys can be added
When the hash function is not defined for a key
